Review Text: you have to delete things manually and it notifies the other person even when you delete it. One by one even when they send a lump sum, and it‚Äôs missing like a swipe to delete functionality. Very hard to see the balance each person owes

Review Title: Changed feature, completely destroyed the actual use for the app
Review Text: You used to be able to see how much you owed each person individually. Now you cannot. Would‚Äôve been great to know this before I went on a trip. Now we have to go through each purchase and add the totals ourselves.
Perfect and easliy

Review Title: Calculations for trip expenses is not easy to view or understand.
Review Text: The app attempts to calculate a recommended way to split expenses and reimburse the group back, but it‚Äôs not clear or easy to understand who has paid who back

Review Title: Great but could use some improvements
Review Text: I really like how easy to use the app is but I would like to see some improvements. I am not a big fan of the auto-calculation of reimbursements. Some people in my group prefer to be paid cash due to currency exchange and while we keep track of expenses in Tricount, we have to kind of keep track of who owes who to be able to pay in cash. I wish there was an option to see all debts without them being combined into the ‚Äúleast amount of transfers‚Äù or a way to search how much money I owe to each person.
Add back the feature where on transaction canteenfor each transaction I could see my individual impact
Use it to track all our Bills.  Came over from splitwise and have been very happy.  One upgrade that would be great would be a notes field for manual text entry.
My tricount have already not function properly for over a week. It state that there‚Äôs something went wrong at bunq‚Äôs side.

Review Title: The app does not do the one thing it needed to do, split costs between more people.
Review Text:
So from the first try, it calculates all wrong. I entered 8 people going on a trip with 2 cars. Person ‚ÄúA‚Äù pays for the insurances for all 8 people and person ‚ÄúB‚Äù pays for the gasoline but only for selected 4 people. 

The person ‚ÄúC‚Äù needs to only pay the person ‚ÄúA‚Äù for the insurance‚Ä¶..but the app calculates that the person ‚ÄúC‚Äù needs to pay the person ‚ÄúA‚Äù for the gasoline even if he is not added to the group, and on the other hand shows that the person ‚ÄúC‚Äù only needs to pay for insurance some small amount that is not realistic to the person ‚ÄúA‚Äù

So already by adding first 2 expenses, the app totally miscalculates everything. 

Imagine if you rely only on this app  to distribute costs, and you do not control al of it at the end‚Ä¶.it will totally miss calculate everything and all participants will get random and uncorrect values.

This is very helpful app, if there is a feature to download the data into excel that would be great help, also if you can add a feature to show expenses in chart format that will be very useful so that we will have all together in one app

I have used this app for a few years now and it‚Äôs been extremely helpful for keeping track of expenses for multiple people paying rent. I am disappointed that when they updated the app they took away the option to export an excel file. I used that feature monthly for budgeting. I hope the developer will consider adding that again. 
For us, the credit card option is not appealing.

Do not use this app! I was asked to update the app in order to keep using it in the middle of my trip and it completely erased all of the data from a weeklong trip right in the middle of it. There was absolutely no easy way to contact customer service and I had to Google what the parent company was in order to find a way to contact someone. The only way to contact them was via email and it was a horrible experience. They say they will get back to you in 10 hours and at first no one got back to me for about 34 hours. Now again remember this is in the middle of our trip. Finally I'm contacted by a trainee who goes back-and-forth with me over a span of TWO MORE WEEKS repeatedly telling me to do things like log out and log back in or delete the app and re-download it, while reassuring me that their team is working hard get my data back. I seriously doubt that they ever even looked at this issue, as after about a week had a they asked me what my login info was associated with my account. I asked them how they were able to be looking into my issue all this time without ever knowing which account was mine, no answer. I asked multiple times to be connected to a manager but was only ever contacted by a trainee. In the end they did not restore my trip and we lost all of our information. Save yourself a headache choose a different platform. The response to this review is ridiculous. No one from the Tricount team tried to help me. I contacted them over and over and over again for weeks and all I ever got was a response from a trainee be patient. Repeatedly I asked for someone from management to contact me and no one ever did. Don't use this app. The response to this bad review is faster than anyone ever responded to my customer service inquiries. I guess they send the same format reply to any bad review, same as they kept sending the same dumb reply to my support requests without answering or addressing a single issue.

With the last update now everything is harder to see. Now you can‚Äôt see only expenses in which you are included, you need to open every single record to see if you are in it. Also, when creating a new record everyone is selected by default, so you need to unselect anyone. Go back to previous version!

Review Title: The best out there but something got to give
Review Text:
The app is free without ads and no limitations. I have no qualms about the alternative monetization through the Bunq credit card. Here's what I like and can be improved: 
+ Adding and editing for others
+ Build in calculator
- Option to sum up everyone's expense instead of forcing to key in total
-  Option to add tax percentage or tip

Optimized reimbursements as a default and no way to disable is annoying and there are use cases where I‚Äôd like to reimburse separately.

There is a data discrepancy between iOS users and Android (just 1cent difference in balances, but concerning in terms of confidence that optimized reimbursements are working correctly) it might be related to one of the expenses being set to ‚Äúpart‚Äù splits and the one cent is a rounding discrepancy.

Inputting expenses was ok, categories were too rigid.

There was a lot of confusion and grief at the end when trying to settle up balances.

Next time I‚Äôll just bite the bullet and just pay for Splitwise Pro temporarily.

Review Title: Used to love it but this last year it went backwards üòï
Review Text:
It‚Äôs an extremely useful app when you travel with friends. I used it for a couple of years and I happily paid for it. Now it‚Äôs only a free version but several essential features have disappeared üò° like: 

- Selection of people who share the expenses by default. So now, after a friend joined you for part of the trip, you have to deselect his name for every expense, until the end of the trip. 

- Summary / stats on total expenses by category. We bothered to enter a category for each expense but it‚Äôs all for nothing as the stats module has disappeared and you can‚Äôt even export to CSV!

Review Title: A great FREE alternative to SplitWise or other paywalled expense splitting apps
Review Text:
I just started using Tricount for managing expenses on group trips.  I really like the interface and the app seems to work well.  It has most of the basic features that I need, but I hope to see a few enhancements: 

- the ability to type the shares in (for share-based expense allocation); hitting the + button 30 times is tedious
- the ability to set default allocations for each expense category type in each Tricount
- the ability to see a summary of total expenses allocated to each member, and the total already paid by each member; presently even the group admin can only see their own expenses (‚Äúmy expenses‚Äù) or a summary of balances, but I would like to be able to see a summary of all members‚Äô total expenses and total amount already paid.
- a web-based interface to manage Tricounts on a PC (in addition to the phone app)

The new app retains the capability to tag your expenses in a certain category, but there‚Äôs no way to filter transactions based on it.

The previous version of the app (pre-redesign) allows that, please bring it back otherwise it‚Äôs a redundant feature.
The sorting feature was the best feature on this app. Please bring it back.
I love this app. Avoid any mistakes.

esta es la mejor app del mercado‚Ä¶.
ideal para viajes con grupos

Review Title: Used it for years! 1 improvement suggested!
Review Text:
Like others, this has also saved my relationship! Instead of constantly asking for transfers back and forth.. we just put the details in the tricount. I even donated I love it so much. 

One feature I would like to add is a search feature. We throw so many expenses on here, sometimes I want to go back and check if I input it, or what it cost. At the moment I need to scroll and pay attention to each line until I find it.

Nifty app!

I absolutely love this app. I truly believe it‚Äôs saved my relationship. My fianc√©e and I were always fighting about money and who paid for what and who owed who. This app makes it so easy. With each purchase I just input the amount and what the purchase was for and if it‚Äôs something that we should split I just check both our names. If a purchase that just he makes then I can enter the info and just check his name. It keeps up with both our money and separates our shared bills and purchases as well as keeps track of individual purchases. Absolutely amazing app. No annoying graphs or linking your accounts. It‚Äôs absolutely amazing. I‚Äôd give it 10 stars if that was an option.

Great app

I had been a loyal Tricount user for years, relying on it to manage shared expenses with my flatmates and for budgeting during both big and small trips. It was a simple yet effective tool that made splitting bills hassle-free. I even subscribed to the paid version before its acquisition because it genuinely added value.

Unfortunately, since the acquisition, the app has gone downhill. The user interface has become unappealing, key features have been removed, such as charts, export/download functionality, and web app access and overall usability has declined. The lack of web access is particularly frustrating, as adding expenses via a phone can often be tedious, making the web version a far quicker option.

More recently, I found that I couldn‚Äôt even generate individual reminders to settle bills, being forced instead into an incomplete bank account integration that still claims the feature is ‚Äúcoming soon.‚Äù At this point, the app no longer meets my needs, so I‚Äôve made the switch to Splitwise. While it costs more than Tricount‚Äôs old pricing, I don‚Äôt mind paying for a service that actually works as intended.

It‚Äôs disappointing to see such a useful app lose its edge, but it‚Äôs time to say goodbye. Tricount was great once, but not anymore.

The transactions and balances from before and after the update make no sense. Is there really no decent app on the market for tracking shared expenses?

einfach zu handhaben aber es w√§re noch sch√∂n, wenn man bei den Insights noch ein Diagramm bez√ºglich der Ausgaben untereinander sehen w√ºrde (wer am meisten ausgegeben hat etc.) und wenn man den Emoji der Liste √§ndern k√∂nnte und wenn man die Kategorien bearbeiten k√∂nnte (neue Namen und Emojis). ‚ò∫Ô∏è

Review Title: Disappointed with the New Update ‚Äì Bring Back the Old Features
Review Text:
I‚Äôve been a long-time user of Tricount, but this recent update has made the app frustrating to use. The previous version had several useful features that made expense tracking seamless, but now, those have been removed, making it harder for users to manage their expenses efficiently.

Key features that need to be brought back:

The ability to Check/Uncheck all users while adding an expense.
An option to view only my expenses for better tracking.
The ability to see detailed expense information without opening it.
Notifications for activity history, showing who added, deleted, or edited an expense.

A new feature that could be beneficial:
Once an expense is locked or closed, no further edits or additions should be allowed to maintain transparency.

I truly hope the team listens to user feedback and restores the remarkable features that made Tricount such a great app. Right now, the update feels like a step backward in terms of usability and convenience. Please take this into account and make necessary improvements. Thank you!
